title: mystery of coverage resolved BUT what should we do? ;)

labels.name: question
labels.description: Issue asks a question rather than reporting a problem

labels.name: conference agenda item
labels.description: Scheduled to be discussed in a developer meeting

body:
apparently consistent "-2%" is due to the fact that "Encrypted environment variables are not available to pull requests from forks due to the security risk of exposing such information to unknown code." i.e. those env vars I have setup in .travis.yml which enable testing of AWS S3 related code are not available withing pull requests and thus those tests do not run.

Possible resolutions:
1. change nothing    pros: easy to do   cons:  can't do merges on the phone,  -2% haunts me
2. just kill those secure env vars.  pros: easy to do   cons: we wouldn't have that code tested anywhere besides our laptops etc
3. we push our PRs via main repository   pros: easy to do,  cons: harder to tidy up.  Already many of us have way too many of those feature branches etc.  It would be somewhat undesired to get them all into main repo.
3.5:  (I kinda like it)  we make datalad-prs  clone, I set env vars for that one as well (I guess I could duplicate) and then we push PRs via it.   pros: we could rinse its all branches whenever no PRs are staged (if ever such time comes), and we could then quickly "add" quick changes to PRs of others without going through full PR to your clone + merge circle.

Do you may be see any other way?   I meanwhile will setup datalad-prs and see if it would work ;)
